instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no USB
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, that works well, but that the USB ports doesn't work, and I don't know where to start.

Testing them with the  Chipmunk USB Tester , on one port I don't have any activity (light). On the other one, it seams to have activity, but have no 5V light. The 5V power rails seams to be ok.

Can you help? Where should I start?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no USB
threads.message:
Realy strange, the USB tester requires 5V power to flash.
Test with a pendrive with Link LED.
Ports fail in both USB 2/3 mode?

Check L4605/705 and small coils in series with USB data lines.
<CHIP>U4650</CHIP> can be easy bypassed, if needed.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no USB
threads.message:
Hi,
I've tested them with a regular pen drive, but no activity (no blink light), and it fails with 2/3 modes.
L4605/705 seams to be ok, and the coils also.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no USB
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all data lines.
Is better to compare with good board.
